title: Proprietary Trader
description:
Job Title: Proprietary Trader

Location: United States

Job Description:

T3 Global Group, LLC is currently seeking skilled and experienced proprietary traders to join our team. As a Trader at T3 Global, you will play a vital role in executing trades across various financial markets. You will have the opportunity to control your own trading strategies and make independent decisions to maximize profitability while being a part of a seasoned trading community.

About:

T3 Global provides elite solutions for the active trading community. Designed with a focus on enabling professionals to effectively scale their trading businesses, T3 includes a diverse community of individuals with backgrounds in investment banking, quantitative trading, private equity, hedge funds, and other non-finance fields. This community collaborates to share market insights and real-time trade ideas.

Benefits

Access to T3's Balance Sheet: Leverage our financial strength to bolster your trading strategies.Professional-Grade Trading Software: Utilize cutting-edge technology designed for professional traders.Customizable Routing: Tailor your trade executions to fit your strategies with our flexible routing options.Stock Locates and Loans: Find and finance the shares you need with our comprehensive stock locate and loan capabilities.Elite Trading Community: Engage with a network of professional traders for live trade discussions, market analysis, and real-time trade ideas.

Responsibilities:

Execute trades in accordance with established trading strategies and risk management guidelines.Monitor market conditions, analyze data, and identify trading opportunities.Conduct thorough research and analysis to develop and refine trading strategies.Utilize advanced trading tools and technology to execute trades efficiently.Monitor and manage trade positions, including risk exposure and portfolio performance.Stay informed about market trends, economic news, and industry developments that may impact trading strategies.Collaborate with other traders and teams to share insights and optimize trading performance.Continuously evaluate and improve trading strategies based on market conditions and performance analysis.Adhere to regulatory and compliance guidelines relevant to trading activities.Maintain accurate records of trades, positions, and performance metrics.First loss capital.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Proven track record of successful trading in one or more financial markets.Strong understanding of trading principles, market dynamics, and risk management strategies.Proficient in utilizing trading platforms and tools to execute trades.Excellent analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data and make informed trading decisions.Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure and make sound decisions in fast-paced trading environments.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate and share insights with other traders.High level of self-motivation, discipline, and resilience.Flexibility to adapt to changing market conditions and trading strategies.

Please note, a background check and additional documents are required prior to joining. Compensation is performance based. If you are passionate about trading, possess a strong work ethic, and thrive in a dynamic trading environment, we encourage you to apply for the Trader position at T3 Global.

description:
Job Title: Derivatives Trader

Location: United States

About T3 Global

T3 Global provides elite solutions for the active trading community, including access to T3's balance sheet, professional-grade trading software, cost-effective execution options, customizable routing, stock locates, and stock loans. Designed with a focus on enabling professionals to effectively scale their trading businesses, T3 includes a diverse community of individuals with backgrounds in investment banking, quantitative trading, private equity, hedge funds, and other non-finance fields. The Derivatives Trader will be responsible for managing a portfolio, developing trading strategies, and risk management decisions for a variety of derivative products including options, futures, and swaps. The role demands a blend of trading skills, market insight, and discipline.

Benefits

Access to T3's Balance Sheet: Leverage our financial strength to bolster your trading strategies.Professional-Grade Trading Software: Utilize cutting-edge technology designed for professional traders.Customizable Routing: Tailor your trade executions to fit your strategies with our flexible routing options.Stock Locates and Loans: Find and finance the shares you need with our comprehensive stock locate and loan capabilities.Elite Trading Community: Engage with a network of professional traders for live trade discussions, market analysis, and real-time trade ideas.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and execute trading strategies in various derivatives markets, including but not limited to equity options, commodity futures, and listed swaps.Conduct rigorous pre-trade analysis and post-trade evaluations.Manage trading book risk, keeping within given parameters and limits.Maintain an in-depth understanding of market structures, liquidity flows, and regulatory changes.Stay abreast of macroeconomic indicators, company news, and other market-moving information.Collaborate with other traders to share ideas and news.Monitor real-time trading systems, ensuring correct operation and performance.First loss capital.

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably at a proprietary trading firm, hedge fund, or investment bank (or equivalent experience).A bachelor’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.Strong analytical skills.Ability to work well under pressure, manage risk, and make decisions rapidly.Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

title: Information Security Analyst
description:
Job Title - Information Security Analyst FULL TIME POSITIONLocation - St. Louis, MissouriExperience - 5+ Years
NOTE : HYBRID ROLEFULL TIME POSITION
Role:The Information Security Analyst is responsible for improving and maintaining a comprehensive Information Security Program for Clients Development. It would include working with all aspects of the client environment including the SCADA network and radio maintenance teams to ensure compliance to all mandates from the governing body. This role seeks to protect against the unauthorized access, modification, or destruction of Clients Development’s systems and information assets. On an on-going basis, this position will manage all activities across Client Development to ensure ongoing data security and validation with current security standards. 
Responsibilities:Research the latest information technology security trends, to keep current and promote use of the latest technology to protect our information by creating recommendations for company-wide best practices.Coordinate/Conduct frequent simulated cyber-attacks and penetration testing to look for vulnerabilities in the computer systems and take care of these before an outside cyber-attack.Tracking and coordinating known cyber vulnerabilities following them to completion and ensuring all are properly closed out. Assist in system monitoring and remediation to manage security alerts and identify/reduce false positives.Development cyber security related strategies and approaches including a cybersecurity breach contingency and recovery plan.Research new tools and technologies to assist in the cyber security area.Coordination with external entities on critical cyber matters.Work with other IT Security team members to share information and promote a secure and proactive IT security environment.Work with emergency management and COOP Planners to ensure that the Information Technology’s recovery plan is fully coordinated with the COOP and emergency plans.Investigate and document security breaches and other cybersecurity incidents including assessing damage potential.Perform computer forensics as needed.Implement and maintain vendor supplied security hardware components & software packages.Perform diagnostics for security problems and identify and analyze security risks.Coordination of security assessments with internal audit and external vendors.Assist in developing security awareness and training programs for IT and employees who work with sensitive data.Create and manage Cyber Security policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines.Work with confidential information obtained through security scans and assessments of Client systems.Report status and progress on efforts to management as necessary.Other related security duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Knowledge of NIST Cyber Security Framework, CIS Security Controls.Experience with network and application security including firewalls, VLANs, routers, switches, Linux, Microsoft Windows and VMware operating systems, Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server databases, ecommerce, PCs.Experience performing penetration testing.Experience setting up firewall rules.Experience performing computer forensics.Experience with designing, implementing and managing an enterprise-wide security program.Experience working with outside vendors to coordinate testing and resolution of security vulnerabilities.Experience writing recovery plans, updating policies/procedures and documenting security breaches.Ability to efficiently and effectively communicate technical information to colleagues and management.Ability to manage time efficiently and multitask when appropriate in potentially high demand scenarios.Ability to solve problems and provide solutions that are technically, financially, and administratively responsible.Ability to provide competent, realistic estimates for cost, effort, and time requirements for assigned initiatives.Completion of one of the following recognized professional certifications: QSA (Qualified Security Assessor), CISM (Certified Information Security Manager), CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional), SSCP (Systems Security Certified Practitioner), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)Education:Degree: B.A./B.S. or equivalent experience required. MS preferredYears: Minimum of two (2) years of cybersecurity experience and a total of 5 or more years’ experience in Information Technology related areasField: Computer Science , IT or related field

title: Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
Company Overview

Moss is a national privately held construction firm providing innovative solutions resulting in award-winning projects. With regional offices across the United States, Moss focuses on construction management, solar EPC, and design-build. The company’s diverse portfolio encompasses a wide range of sectors, including luxury high-rise residential, landmark mixed-use developments, hospitality, K-12 and higher education, justice, solar energy and battery storage, and sports. Moss is ranked by Engineering News-Record as the nation’s top solar contractor and one of the top 50 general contractors. Moss prides itself on a strong entrepreneurial culture that honors safety, quality, client engagement, and employee development. Its employees consistently rank Moss as one of the best places to work.

POSITION SCOPE AND ORGANIZATIONAL IMPACT

Moss’ FP&A Analyst supports the Manager of FP&A in providing the enterprise with value-added financial analytics. This hands-on corporate finance position reports to the FP&A Manager and is a key member of the corporate finance team. This individual is responsible for preparing forecasts and analysis of results in support of business objectives, assisting in the budget process, and providing executive reporting. The candidate must be a cross-functional team player, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and able to think outside the box, while building and maintaining productive positive relationships with dispersed business units and management teams.

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

Responsible for the aggregation and preparation of various forecasts, for a fast-growing enterprise. Includes reconciliation of those forecasts to actual. Accurate forecasts will require discovering, compiling, and analyzing financial and nonfinancial dataComplete complex analysis, provide sensitivity analysis and data, and make sound recommendationsPrepare ad-hoc analysis and provide recommendations to FP&A Manager to report out findingsCommunicates relevant financial information on a timely basis to internal teamsPerforms other duties as assigned

Education And Work Experience

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance preferredOne to two years’ progressive finance or big four experience, including involvement with complex spreadsheet modelsExcellent communication and critical thinking skillsStrong analytical skills; able to clearly link financial results to operational performance drivers, generate alternatives, and drive positive changeGood grasp of accounting concepts as they relate to corporate financial analysis and preparation of forecasted financial statementsDemonstrated ability to analyze and understand research from both public and private sourcesHigh-performing independent thinker with excellent critical thinking and communication skills, as well as the ability to work independently. Flexibility, initiative, time management, and organizational skills are criticalAttention to detail and works well with deadlinesExcellent customer service and problem-solving skills required. Ideal candidate is results and action orientedIntermediate Microsoft Excel skills with willingness to learn and improveProactive individual with strong ability to build and maintain relationships with all business leadersExposure to commercial construction and/or renewable energy construction management

JOB TITLE: FP&A ANALYST

JOB LOCATION: FORT LAUDERDALE, FL

CLASSIFICATION: FULL TIME – EXEMPT – SALARIED

REPORTS TO: MANAGER, FINANCIAL PLANNING & ANALYSIS

Moss is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Merchandise Manager
description:
At Five Below our growth is a result of the people who embrace our purpose: We know life is way better when you are free to Let Go & Have Fun in an amazing experience, filled with unlimited possibilities, priced so low, you can always say yes to the newest, coolest stuff! Just ask any of our over 17,000 associates who work at Five Below and they’ll tell you there’s no other place like it. It all starts with our purpose and then, The Five Below Way, which is our values and behaviors that each and every associate believes in.

It’s all about culture at Five Below, making this a place that can inspire you as much as you inspire us with big ideas, super energy, passion, and the ability to make the workplace a WOWplace!

What does the Merchandise Manager do?

Under the leadership of the Store Manager, directly leads the Freight team, and all associates of the store while the Manager on Duty. The Merchandise Manager (MM) is responsible for executing merchandising standards throughout the store. The Merchandise Manager is also responsible to “Wow the Customer”, operational controls, inventory integrity, asset protection, cleanliness, safety and driving sales.

How do they do it?

As a Five Below leader, your first priority is to contribute to the success of your store. This means that you not only deliver in your role as the Merchandise Manager, but you also model leadership behaviors and deliver as a manager on duty. As the Manager on Duty, you deliver results during your assigned time, drive key performance indicators and brand loyalty by leading through your team. The Merchandise Manager is part of the management team that sets the tone by embracing and living the Five Below Value! These values translate into creating the coolest brand on the plant, where talented people want to grow their careers…and here is how!

Wow the Customer: Put the customer first and make a difference in people’s lives

Unleash Passion: Check your ego at the door and do what you say you will do

Hold the Penny Hostage: Treat Five Below like your own business and hire talent that will do the same

Achieve the Impossible: Set the bar high for self and team and make sure to take risks

Work Hard, Have Fun, Build a Career: Come to work ready to take on the day, create a fun atmosphere and recognize the team for all the efforts

Key Attributes of MM:

LeadershipTrainer/Developer/MotivatorCommunicationOwnership/CommitmentAccountability/Delegation/Follow UpSales Driver/Goal OrientedProfessionalismEmerging Skill - Planning/Time Management

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Ensures Merchandise Movement Process is flawlessly executedResponsible for merchandising, signing, and resets in Now, Style, Room, Tech, and PartyResponsible for opening and closing store proceduresResponsible for performing SM duties in their absenceAssists in supervising all AssociatesAssists in training all AssociatesAssists in coaching all AssociatesAssists in developing all AssociatesAssists in staff schedulingReviews all corporate communications and reacts accordinglyPartners with supervisors or corporate office regarding store issuesDrives store sales and controls expensesDrives store sales which may include performing in all Five Below services (ear piercing, balloons, buy online pick up in store, etc.)Uses financial reporting to drive business opportunitiesAssists payroll process and ensures budget is in line with planAssists in merchandising proceduresResponsible for maintaining assigned zoneSets and maintains Market Plan, Signage, and other Merchandise SetsEnsures the execution of company Inventory Integrity processAdheres to and holds associates accountable to all Five Below’s Standard Operating Procedures(SOP)Responsible for cash handling procedures including but not limited to preparing and dropping bank depositsAuthorizes register functions including post voids, returns and discountsComplies with Human Resources policies and proceduresLeads Asset Protection and Safety processes and holds associates accountableDelivers exceptional customer service through personal contact with customersAssists in receiving and stocking proceduresUnloads merchandise from trucksChecks in shipmentsStages merchandise for the sales floorPacks out merchandiseLeads and ensures Five Below’s Packaway Process is completed within timeframes providedPerforms store maintenance including but not limited to taking out garbage, sweeping, cleaning bathrooms, maintaining stock room

This job description is not all-inclusive. Additional responsibilities will be determined by the Store Manager, as dictated by store needs.

Key Measurables:

SalesAP AuditsShrink ResultsExpense ControlADSCSAT scores

Essential Job Functions:

Frequently operate cash registerFrequently move merchandise weighing up to 25 lbs and places/removes merchandise up to a height of 5-10 feetFrequently ascend/descend ladders in order to retrieve and put away stockFrequently position self to kneel, bend, twist, and stoop, including in the stock room and on the sales floorFrequently communicate and exchange information with customers on the telephone and face-to-face in the store, as well as with managers and coworkers. title: Account Manager
description:
Account Manager
Concord Technologies is currently seeking an Account Manager for its growing team in Seattle, Washington. We are looking for exceptional individuals with a competitive spirit and the desire to put in the work to become a top performer.  Based remotely, the Account Manager is a key contributor to the continued success of Concord’s growing Sales Team. In this frontline, position you will be the first touch point between Concord and new prospective customers responsible for building sales/lead pipeline for the sales organizations. Concord craves your contribution of passion, commitment to excellence, high energy, and devotion to always doing what’s right to build upon our vastly diverse and intellectually stimulating work environment. Concord is committed to the ongoing career development of its employees and has standardized on Miller-Heiman-based selling principles to accelerate deal closure. Miller-Heiman classroom, remote learning, and/or book study opportunities are provided by Concord. Here's the thing: We're growing. Fast. And if your idea of a good time is being a part of something big, then this is the place—and the team—for you.  
Essential Functions:
Account Manager, you will play a crucial role in managing a diverse portfolio of customer accounts, cultivating strong relationships, and driving revenue growth through upsell opportunities. If you are passionate about delivering exceptional customer service and have a proven track record in account management, we invite you to apply. 
Take ownership of the entire sales process, including conducting discovery calls to drive pipeline growth and generate revenue within your assigned accounts. The Account Manager is responsible for proactive prospecting efforts aimed at driving revenue growth. Exceed annual revenue targets by effectively managing and growing your account portfolio. Identify and capitalize on upsell opportunities within existing accounts to achieve quota targets. Provide outstanding client relationship management for both new and existing clients. Act as a trusted advisor, assisting clients in leveraging Concord's product offerings to achieve their business objectives. 


Position Requirements:
College Graduate, or equivalent experience 8+ years of individual quota-carrying sales experience Proven track record of achieving performance goals including quotas, revenue targets, and other key performance metrics. Experience in facilitating resolution to customer problems Strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills. Capable to work independently as well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment 
The on-target earnings (OTE) range for this role is $130,000 - $180,000 (base plus variable.) Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including the candidate's qualifications, skills, competencies, location and experience, and may fall outside of the range shown.
Additional employee benefits at Concord Technologies:401K plan w/ 6% company match (vests immediately)Flex-Time off + sick time10 company holidaysFull suite of health benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)– employee only coverage covered at 100% (no employee cost). For employees + dependents, Concord covers 60% of premiums. Voluntary insurance options:Pet insurance options (dog/cat)Employee Life and AD&DSpousal Life and AD&DChild Life and AD&DPaid Parental Leave programFree unlimited ORCA card (Seattle area residents)Employee Rewards and Recognition through NectarHRUnlimited access to Udemy for Business

About Concord Technologies:Concord Technologies is a provider of secure document exchange, intelligent document automation, and workflow solutions to healthcare providers, payers, and other highly regulated businesses. Concord’s suite of solutions has been providing swift and secure document transmission for more than two decades, transmitting 3 billion pages a year while supporting more than 1,500 organizations every day. The company is also recognized for its best-in-class development of new artificial intelligence technologies and industry-leading applications that help its customers grow and manage their business. Concord’s superior service and forward thinking have been rewarded with a client retention rate of more than 98% year over year. 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

title: Sales Development Representative II
description:
Location: Work is what you do, not where you go. For this role, we are open to remote work and can hire anywhere in the United States or Canada

About The Opportunity

We are seeking a motivated and dynamic Sales Development Representative to join our growing team. As a Sales Development Representative, you will play a crucial role in driving our company's growth by managing inbound inquiries, qualifying leads, and contributing to pipeline creation. Your primary focus will be monitoring and responding to inbound leads, initiating contact, and nurturing relationships to ultimately convert leads into qualified opportunities for our sales team.

What You’ll Get To Do

Inbound Lead Management:

Monitor and manage incoming leads from various sources, including phone and website inquiries, marketing campaigns, and events.Respond promptly and according to SLAs to inbound leads, gathering initial information and assessing their potential fit as opportunities for our sales team. Schedule high-quality, BANT qualified meetings (SQLs) for Account Executives.

Account Enrichment

Research and gather relevant information about leads and prospects to enhance data quality in our CRM system.Update and maintain accurate contact details, company information, and other pertinent data in Salesforce.Utilize online resources and tools to gather insights and intelligence on target companies and their key decision-makers.

Salesforce Updates

Ensure accurate and timely updates of lead interactions, account activities, and notes in Salesforce.Regularly review and cleanse data to maintain database hygiene and accuracy.Maintain accurate records of lead interactions, outreach efforts, and progress in generating qualified leads.Provide regular reports on key performance metrics, including lead conversion rates. 

Skills And Experience We Value

1-2 years related experience required. Previous phone sales/appointment setting experience.Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRM platforms. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport and establish relationships.Detail-oriented and proficient in data entry and maintaining accurate records.Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently.Comfortable with making outbound phone calls and engaging in outbound prospecting activities.

title: Client Operations Associate
description:
Strategic Context

Our vision is to be the single reference point for service to families of significant wealth. Our mission is to be the family office that defines exceptional client experience. We seek to provide the most high-touch, objective expertise needed to support and serve the wealth of families and families of wealth.

Our core services to families include Investment Advisory (asset allocation strategy, research, portfolio implementation, and investment reporting), Family Wealth (tax strategy and compliance, estate advisory, risk management, expense management and philanthropic planning and advisory), Capital Advisory (liquidity planning, capital structure advisory, lending and cash management), and Fiduciary (estate settlement, trusteeship and trust). We deliver services to clients primarily through BMO Family Office, LLC, BMO Bank N.A., and BMO Delaware Trust. Together, we have over 130 professionals who service approximately 300 families and manage or advise on approximately $12 billion in assets and administer another $6 billion in assets.

Role Mandate

This role requires a person who is motivated, eager to learn, likes to get things done and has a mentality of ownership. We seek individuals who can identify issues and develop solutions. The associate will have the opportunity to interact with a dynamic and intellectual group of professionals who believes in improving not only the client’s experience, but the employee experience as well.

The Client Operations Team oversees client onboarding, service and administration, coordinates portfolio implementation on a multi-custodial investment platform, and provides alternative investment administration. The associate will learn and assist team members and the functions of the group. In addition, the associate will work with members of the Family Wealth and Investment Advisory teams.

Key Dimensions

Accurately complete appropriate know-your-client account documentation and update systems to reflect current information on client accountsPrioritize and follow up on tasks in a timely fashionOwn certain centralized client service activities and backup on othersOrganize and maintain client filesLog, review and track client service activities


Key Accountabilities

Prepare and/or review various client documentation requirementsSetup, input and monitor client and account information on various custodial platformsInitiate account opening, account maintenance and money movement requestsManage incoming and outgoing documentation (electronic and other) for the teamPerform various client service activities for client facing professionalsCoordinate investment implementation with internal and external business partners and fund companies, as neededProcess trades, wires, capital calls, and distributions etc.Support various compliance and anti-money laundering program requirementsUpload and organize account statements and financial documents


Knowledge And Skills

Two to three years financial services experience, preferably in a client service and/or investment operations roleBachelor’s degree preferredProficient in Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPointKnowledge of financial markets or investments is a plusFamiliarity or experience with investment reporting platforms is a plusAbility to work under tight deadlines and balance/prioritize tasksStrong written and verbal communication skillsIndividual must be able to work independently and in a teamAttention to detail and ability to practically apply written policy and procedures


Working Conditions

Professional office environment


Compensation and Benefits:

$44,000.00 - $82,000.00

Pay Type:

Salaried

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

title: Experienced Trader
description:
Job Title: Experienced Trader

Location: New York; California; Florida; Texas; Illinois; Massachusetts

About T3 Global:

T3 Global provides elite solutions for the active trading community, including access to T3's balance sheet, professional-grade trading software, cost-effective execution options, customizable routing, stock locates, and stock loans. Designed with a focus on enabling professionals to effectively scale their trading businesses, T3 includes a diverse community of individuals with backgrounds in investment banking, quantitative trading, private equity, hedge funds, and other non-finance fields. This community collaborates to share market insights and real-time trade ideas. T3 currently offers trading opportunities in Futures, Equities, Options, and Cryptocurrencies.

Job Description:

T3 Global Group, LLC is in search of seasoned traders to be a part of our elite team. This role is reserved for professionals with substantial trading experience and expertise. Our traders are pivotal in executing trades across multifaceted financial markets, operating with autonomy to devise their trading strategies while being part of a rich trading ecosystem.

Benefits:

Access to T3's Balance Sheet: Leverage our financial strength to bolster your trading strategies.Professional-Grade Trading Software: Utilize cutting-edge technology designed for professional traders.Customizable Routing: Tailor your trade executions to fit your strategies with our flexible routing options.Stock Locates and Loans: Find and finance the shares you need with our comprehensive stock locate and loan capabilities.Elite Trading Community: Engage with a network of professional traders for live trade discussions, market analysis, and real-time trade ideas.

Responsibilities:

Execute trades in accordance with established trading strategies and risk management guidelines.Monitor market conditions, analyze data, and identify trading opportunities.Conduct thorough research and analysis to develop and refine trading strategies.Utilize advanced trading tools and technology to execute trades efficiently.Monitor and manage trade positions, including risk exposure and portfolio performance.Stay informed about market trends, economic news, and industry developments that may impact trading strategies.Collaborate with other traders and teams to share insights and optimize trading performance.Continuously evaluate and improve trading strategies based on market conditions and performance analysis.Adhere to regulatory and compliance guidelines relevant to trading activities.Maintain accurate records of trades, positions, and performance metrics.First loss capital.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, mathematics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Proven track record of successful trading in one or more financial markets.Strong understanding of trading principles, market dynamics, and risk management strategies.Proficient in utilizing trading platforms and tools to execute trades.Excellent analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data and make informed trading decisions.Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure and make sound decisions in fast-paced trading environments.Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate and share insights with other traders.High level of self-motivation, discipline, and resilience.Flexibility to adapt to changing market conditions and trading strategies.

Please note, a background check and additional documents are required prior to joining. Compensation is performance based. If you are passionate about trading, possess a strong work ethic, and thrive in a dynamic trading environment, we encourage you to apply for the Trader position at T3 Global.

title: Latin America Sales Executive
description:
Latin America Sales Representative
BuildingReports seeks a dynamic and motivated Sales Representative/AccountManager to expand and support our member network of Service Companies in the Latin America market. The ideal candidate must possess a thorough understanding of technology and be proficient in BuildingReports services. A successful track record in B2B software sales is essential, with a preference for experience in Channel Sales. This role necessitates an individual with a strong sense of ethics, confidence, logical thinking, and knowledge to assist, educate, and recommend the appropriate BuildingReports services to prospective customers at all levels, from field and administrative staff to Executive Management.
Responsibilities:Assist - Support the sales staff of network members during calls with existing and prospective customers.Close - Follow up on inquiries generated through marketing leads, online registrations, etc.Consult - Offer guidance to prospective and existing customers on technology and best practice procedures.Demonstrate - Showcase BuildingReports technology and services in both in-person and online settings to prospective customers.Educate - Train members' service and administration staff on existing features.Exhibit - Participate in regional and national trade shows and conferences.Feedback - Provide direct technology feedback to the development team.Improvements - Introduce and demonstrate new and upgraded services.Knowledge - Possess a comprehensive understanding of all service companies in the region, both within and outside the network.Liaison - Serve as the primary point of contact for service members within the region.Maintain - Manage mailing lists and internal contact databases.Marketing - Offer tools and assistance for marketing efforts.Organizations - Join, speak at, and demonstrate to local and regional chapters.Partnerships - Assist prospective customers in connecting with network partners for local, regional, national, and international accounts.Report - Forecast future sales expectations.Sales - Provide sales and reselling tools and training.Search - Utilize the internet, social media, etc., to identify suitable sales opportunities.Utilize - Re-connect with previous inquirers using the existing database.Travel - Be present "in region" approximately 4-6 times per year.
Qualifications:Fluency in both Spanish and English is essential, with proficiency in additional languages considered advantageous.A bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification is preferred.Candidates should possess a minimum of 3 years of previous experience in software sales, preferably in a B2B setting with a preference for experience in channel sales.Familiarity with Mobile and Web-based (Cloud Networking) technologies is highly desirable.Experience with BuildingReports or within the Fire, Life Safety, or Security industry is a plus.An enthusiasm for and proficiency with technology is a must-have trait!
Job Type: Full-Time, Exempt
Compensation: $70k Annual Base plus commission.
Travel: Expect to undertake approximately 4 to 6 in-territory trips annually for training sessions, prospective customer meetings, national or regional trade shows, and other related events. Additionally, participation in major USA expos as the Latin American Representative is required.
About Us:Building safety compliance is critical to service companies, building owners and fire and safety officials who are charged with safeguarding occupants. BuildingReports’s mobile and online inspection reporting tools enable inspectors to quickly gather data on fire and life safety devices to ensure the working order and code requirements through easily verifiable inspection reports. With more than 8 million inspections to date, over 1 million buildings with 500 million devices represented, and over 1,000 inspection companies in its network, BuildingReports has earned its reputation as the most trusted name in compliance reporting. title: Sourcing Manager
description:
Overview

As a Sourcing Manager working for GSI, you will be a key player in allowing the organization to quickly, accurately, and cost effectively respond to our client needs in a fast paced and dynamic environment. This role will serve as the regional spend manager and will support regional savings goals. This role will connect Proposal Development and Planning Phases by working with internal and external stakeholders to obtain quotations, increase estimating accuracy, reduce cost, reduce inventory, and improve operational execution through leveraged supplier relationships.

Who is GeoStabilization International®?

GeoStabilization International® (GSI) develops and installs innovative solutions that protect people and infrastructure from the dangers of geohazards. We specialize in emergency landslide repairs, rockfall mitigation, and grouting, using cutting edge design/build and design/build/warranty contracting. GeoStabilization International is the leading geohazard mitigation and bridge rehabilitation firm operating throughout the United States. Our expertise, proprietary tools, and worldwide partnerships allow us to repair virtually any slope stability or foundation problem in any geologic setting.

Responsibilities

What work will I be performing?

 Serve as regional spend manager and owner of regional savings initiatives.  Support proposal development by securing and analyze quotations for materials, subcontracts, logistics, and rental equipment.  Support operational planning and execution: Develop project budgets and calculate material take-offs.  Negotiate price and commercial terms with suppliers and subcontractors to obtain cost savings and maximize value.  Select suppliers/subcontractors and place Purchase Orders for materials, subcontracts, logistics, and rental equipment per budget.  Coordinate with PMs, Superintendents, Operations Managers, Regional Directors, Warehouse, and Equipment Team to reduce downtime, optimize logistics, and coordinate equipment moves.  Maintain preferred supplier relationships and manage commodities to improve service, expedite needs, reduce project downtime, decrease project costs, and resolve any accounting issues.  Effectively manage equipment rental process for reduced cost  Maintain and ensure compliance for DBE requirements and mill certs.  Subject Matter Expert and Regional Trainer for standardized procurement process and platform. 

Qualifications

Our offices are in Westminster, CO. This role is a hybrid in-office role. Tue-Thur are in-office with the ability to work remotely on Monday and Fridays.

What Do I Need to Bring?

 Bachelor's Degree from an accredited four-year college or university in Business, Logistics/Supply Chain, or a directly related field with minimum 2 years’ experience in a procurement support function  Familiarity with Lean Principles, Max/Min Inventory, Supplier Scheduling and Planning  Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work well in a collaborative results-oriented team environment.  Personal and professional values and goals aligned with company values and culture including a demonstrated passion for the business and customers.  Experienced Microsoft Office user with high level efficiencies in Microsoft Excel  Experience in Viewpoint is beneficial 

GeoStabilization International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.

description:

title: Equipment Maintenance Technician - SMT
description:
Equipment Maintenance Technician

Seguin, TEXAS

Vitesco Technologies is an international leader specializing in the development and manufacture of cutting-edge powertrain technologies. Our commitment to sustainability is exemplified through our innovative solutions and components for electric, hybrid, and internal combustion drivetrains, aimed at making mobility clean, efficient, and affordable. We are excited to invite a motivated and skilled Equipment Maintenance Technician to join our dynamic team at our Seguin, TX location.

Position Overview: The Equipment Maintenance Technician is pivotal in maintaining optimum functionality in our production equipment. This role involves advanced troubleshooting, preventive maintenance, and continuous improvement of our production processes.

Responsibilities:

Execute advanced troubleshooting across electrical, electronic, pneumatic, hydraulic, and mechanical systems, inclusive of computer and custom machine software systems.Uphold the operational efficiency of machine line operations through maintenance, repair, and parts replacement.Coordinate with engineers and managers for optimal line moves and installation.Support the development and refinement of preventative maintenance procedures and actively participate in the design and implementation of special operational efficiency improvement projects.Promote a proactive and teamwork-oriented environment, collaborating with peers, operators, and management.Maintain compliance with all work environment procedures and contribute to enhancements.Uphold a high standard of work ethic, skill application, and communication.Document all changes to processes and equipment and maintain a proactive stance in equipment and process dealings.


Basic Qualifications:

Associates of Applied Science in Electronics, Mechatronics, or similar technical degree, or Military Maintenance Training Certification, or 3+ years of equivalent experience as an Electro-Mechanical Maintenance Technician. Candidates within 1 semester of finishing one of the aforementioned degree plans will also be considered.Proficient in troubleshooting electronic and electro-mechanical systems.Ability to read and interpret electronic and pneumatic schematics.Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job openings.


Preferred Qualifications:

6+ years of experience in repair or maintenance.Strong mechanical aptitude with an emphasis on understanding mechanics and troubleshooting.Proficiency in using computer programs to control electronic or electro-mechanical devices.Familiarity with various programming software packages.Experience or aptitude for mentoring and develop junior technicians, fostering skill growth and proper troubleshooting techniques.Possess strong, clear, verbal and written communication skills


Physical and Mental Demands:

Why Join Vitesco Technologies?

Immediate BenefitsPaid Time OffTuition & Employee DiscountsAnnual BonusEmployer 401(k) MatchAdditional benefits associated with being a part of a global industry leader!

If you’re ready to shape the future with us and meet the above requirements, we invite you to apply and become a part of our forward-thinking team, contributing to cleaner, more efficient, and affordable mobility solutions.

title: Best Practices Manager
description:
Company Overview

Moss is a national privately held construction firm providing innovative solutions resulting in award-winning projects. With regional offices across the United States, Moss focuses on construction management, solar EPC, and design-build. The company’s diverse portfolio encompasses a wide range of sectors, including luxury high-rise residential, landmark mixed-use developments, hospitality, K-12 and higher education, justice, solar energy and battery storage, and sports. Moss is ranked by Engineering News-Record as the nation’s top solar contractor and one of the top 50 general contractors. Moss prides itself on a strong entrepreneurial culture that honors safety, quality, client engagement, and employee development. Its employees consistently rank Moss as one of the best places to work.

POSITION SCOPE AND ORGANIZATIONAL IMPACT

As a member of our HR team, the Best Practices Manager will have an opportunity to lead, strategize, influence, and enable business operations to achieve results through the effective management of policy and compliance. This individual will coach and mentor HR team members and business leaders on appropriate HR compliance solutions, both proactively and tactically. This role will be expected to work cross functionally between HR Centers of Expertise (COEs), Field HR, Operations, Legal, Accounting, Finance, Safety, Risk, and other functions as needed.

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

Develop and deliver HR Compliance programs, policies, and projects, bringing together and influencing cross-functional teamsWork closely with Moss Legal team to identify and remediate compliance gaps and follow up with relevant stakeholders to closureMonitor, track and communicate regulatory changes that may impact compliance requirements and business processes, partnering with stakeholders to assess risks and implement requisite controlsConduct periodic and cyclical audits to assess the effectiveness of HR programs in meeting compliance standardsAdminister all required regulatory leaves of absence, in collaboration with the broader HR team and business leaders, and in alignment with Company policyManage immigration compliance programs, partnering with external counsel on visa processing, to ensure all employees have legal work authorizationManage required worksite poster compliance programLead prospective vendor evaluation and selection process, in partnership with internal stakeholders, and proactively manage relationship with current vendorsGather buy-in for, craft, and maintain enterprise-wide policies and process documents that support HR programs and initiatives, including the Employee HandbookManage and audit process for Fair Labor Standards Act and EEOC job classifications, and ensure required Equal Employment Opportunities Commission (EEOC) reporting (EE0-1 Component 1) is submitted timelyPartner in the development and execution of change management initiatives, which may include development and execution of training materials and accompanying documentationPerform other duties as assigned

Education And Work Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Regulatory Affairs, Human Resources, Business Management, or related fields, preferredCandidate must have at least 5+ years combined related experience in regulatory/compliance field and/or investigations. Experience in policy development, compliance, risk management, labor relations and human capital are preferred. Experience with developing and delivering Compliance programs essentialExperience building cross-functional partnerships and influencing stakeholders across the organization to act without having a direct reporting relationshipAbility to quickly adapt to changing priorities and generate innovative solutions; Demonstrate and maintain a high degree of confidentiality and professionalismProficiency in HRIS systems; Workday HCM and Absence experience preferredMust be proficient in all Microsoft Office applications. Should have good comfort level with integrating multiple applications to streamline operations through technology solutionsExcellent analytical and problem-solving skills

title: Business Operations
description:
Founding BizOps At Column Tax, we’re building the next generation of tax preparation software. Come join us to build a delightful, transparent, and easy to use tax filing system. 
💻 About you:In order to be successful in this role, you’ll have to be a business & operations “generalist” who is able to flex across a variety of areas. We believe that people from a wide range of backgrounds have the opportunity to be successful in this role. Some examples of ones that might be a fit:You have been on a BizOps team as an IC and want a step up in responsibility & ownershipYou’ve worked in a business function (Sales, Finance, etc.) and want a wider range of experience and ownershipYou’ve worked in Marketing. You are excited about leading Marketing at Column but also want to grow as a business generalistYou are working in consulting or finance and want to make a step to working at a startup
As a person, you most likely are:A do-er at heart. Your default is to lean in and get it done, whatever “it” is. Able to pair strategy with execution (”Figure out what to do. Then do it.”)Someone who has worked at an early-stage startup (or has experience working in an environment with an intense pace)Comfortable “figuring it out.” Many times you’ll be solving a problem that you haven’t worked on previously. You should be the kind of person who’s excited about figuring it out, and the messy-ness that comes with that!Someone who hasn’t seen a problem you weren’t excited to solve 😄 The kind of person who gets excited about doing the little things needed to make a company run 
⭐ Things we value:Focus: we know that doing great work takes long blocks of uninterrupted timeOwnership: everyone at Column is empowered to make big decisionsTransparency: expect honest & vulnerable communicationVision: everyone on our team dreams big about solving complex problemsDoing the right thing: Tax is an industry with a history of predatory practices; we’re determined to fix that

title: Director of Leasing

Our experienced team is rooted in our core values: Gratitude, Integrity, Drive & Innovation. We started our property management department to enhance and protect our own properties. Realizing our own success and knowing others could benefit from it, we expanded this service to include our clients and we now manage over 125 properties throughout the United States.
Role DescriptionReporting to the President, the Director of Leasing is responsible for overseeing the leasing activities for the SW Managed portfolio to ensure maximum occupancy within the portfolio. The Director of Leasing will be responsible for developing and implementing proactive, creative leasing strategies to attract and retain tenants, negotiate lease agreements, and maintain strong relationships with tenants, brokers and other stakeholders. The Director of Leasing will maintain real-time market intelligence and expand our network and brand in target markets. 
Essential Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Develop, execute and oversee leasing, merchandising and value-creation strategies and plans• Lead portfolio reviews with preferred regional and national tenants• Manage direct report and third-party leasing relationships• Lead, manage and hold accountable any Leasing Associates or direct reports• Support the Asset Management Team and 3rd Party Owners in executing the Business Plan• Execute a highly accretive renewal effort• Oversee Lease Assignments• Market properties for lease as needed• Answer inquiries, show spaces, negotiate LOIs, perform lease analysis, and approve prospective tenants• Negotiate and finalize lease agreements• Develop detailed Market Lease Assumptions and set rates for the portfolio• Ensure efficiency and profitability of the department by ensuring that department milestones are• Create and maintain leasing pipeline reports • Generate competitive market reports• Participate in national and regional trade shows• Remain current on market trends by reading, analyzing, and interpreting periodicals and professional journals• Effectively present information and respond to inquiries from management, co‐workers, tenants, and Owners• Build and maintain strong relationships with Owners• Assist in overall business development of SW• Assist with other projects, as directed
Preferred QualificationsBachelor’s degree in real estate, business or related field preferredMinimum 5 years experience in real estate leasingAbility to comprehend, analyze, and interpret real estate terms, principals, and documentsHigh degree of initiative, self-direction, and attention to detailExcellent written and oral communication skillsStrong organizational and analytical skillsMust be proactive, responsive and resourcefulAbility to multi-task and work well under pressure requiredDemonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Office 365Commercial Leasing and Lease Negotiations skillsAbility to build and maintain relationships with clients and tenants

title: Credit Dispute Specialist
description:

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Ottimate helps fast growing businesses automate accounts payables on their terms. We simplify everything from invoice management to payments for both recurring and one-off expenses with a cloud-first approach that enables remote work. Ottimate's AP Automation and VendorPay Network helps businesses pay and get paid faster. Our verticals include restaurant, hotel/country club, grocery, construction, and distribution.
At Ottimate, passion generates excitement for what we do and how we do it. With passion at the heart of everything we do, we nurture ideas, inspire excellence, and find creative ways to eliminate obstacles for cultivating growth. The positive attitude with which we assist one another develops open, honest, and genuine connections. Above all, we celebrate and embrace our differences. We invest in each other because we win or lose as a team.
Our values are at the center of our company and culture. At Ottimate, we value: Growth, Customer Focus, Innovation, Accountability, and Communication.
The Role
The Sales Development Representative role is perfect for ambitious, high-energy professionals eager to make a big impact. You'll drive Plate IQ’s sales by sourcing, contacting, educating, and qualifying prospects via phone, email, and social channels. 
Our SDR position rewards initiative and hard work. As such, our top SDRs are goal-driven, humble, and adaptable team players who embrace feedback, excel in fast-paced environments, and possess a relentless drive to succeed. They're self-starters unafraid of risks, recognizing that failure and rejection drive success, and they're always eager to expand their knowledge. This role is based out of our Tampa, FL office and will be in-person 5 days a week.
Key ResponsibilitiesProspecting and Generation of Sales Opportunities: As a SDR, your primary duty is to initiate sales cycles and expand the sales pipeline by identifying and developing sales-ready opportunities. This involves actively engaging in self-prospecting and generating leads through research and outreach with the ultimate goal of scheduling qualified meetings with prospects. High-Volume Outbound Cold Calling: You will spend a substantial portion of your day making outbound cold calls to potential prospects, effectively communicating Ottimate's value proposition.Prospect Engagement: Engage with a diverse range of prospects, from Directors to C-Suite Executives, within the United States, fostering relationships through phone, email, and social media.Prospect Research: Conduct thorough research to navigate and identify key contacts and stakeholders within prospect organizations.Effective Communication: Clearly articulate Ottimate's unique value proposition and differentiators through cold calls, personalized emails, and LinkedIn prospecting.Account Nurturing: Nurture accounts throughout the prospect lifecycle, ensuring they are ready to engage further.Collaboration: Collaborate closely with Account Executives to strategically manage outreach to target accounts.Data Management: Utilize Salesforce to maintain accurate contact information and ensure data integrity.Product Knowledge: Acquire in-depth knowledge of prospective customers' pain points and how Ottimate’s product addresses them.Continuous Improvement: Work collaboratively with the broader sales team to continually improve individually and as a team.Market Awareness: Stay current on Ottimate's platform, competitive landscape, and market trends.
Ingredients Located in or around the Tampa Bay area with the ability to work in-person 5 days per week (potential for hybrid with proven performance).A bachelor's degree is required.Up to 2 years professional experience (ideally in a customer-facing or quota-carrying role)Inherently curious with strong desire to learn and advance in a sales career; embraces coaching, feedback, and learning opportunities.Relentless drive and accountability to achieve and exceed goals and expectationsExcellent sales instinct with an ability to identify opportunities and resolve roadblocksEngaging phone presence; astute listener and effective communicator with an inherent ability to interact, engage, build relationships, and communicate with individuals at all organizational levelsArticulate written communicator who can convey complex ideas simply and write engaging emails to prospectsAdaptable to changing internal and external environments and evolving strategyHighly organized; manages time effectively and works independently in a fast-paced startup environment
Flavor Enhancers:Previous SDR experience is a big plusPast experience in relevant or adjacent market
A Recipe For Total RewardsWe care deeply about making Plate IQ an incredible place to work and invest a significant amount of time and energy into creating and maintaining a company culture that provides our team with a generous level of support whilst inspiring them to do their best work. 
The specific benefits/perks we offer are continually evolving, but currently include:Compensation: $55K + VariableCompetitive salary based on skills & experience.Medical, Dental, Vision and other Company-Subsidized Benefits for you and your family.Employer sponsored 401(k) with company match.Paid Time Off (and the encouragement to use it).Annual company retreats.Promote from within philosophy.
Beyond the tangible benefits though:You will be part of a growing team, at a pinnacle moment of scale for the business, and experience the excitement of working in a startup where each action makes a huge difference.You will have the agency to solve difficult problems creatively, the freedom to explore work that inspires you, and infrastructure to ensure you're constantly challenged and developing.You will work with sharp, passionate teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and positioning our product as a premier finance automation solution. Our commitment to empowering a diverse and inclusive workforce, celebrating differences, and creating a safe space for our employees to bring their whole selves to work is second to note.We are transforming entire industries using innovative technology including Artificial Intelligence, Payment Tech, and Neural Networks.Our leaders lead with a people-first approach; inspiring excellence, nurturing ideas, and finding creative ways to eliminate obstacles for cultivating growth.We truly love what we do and who we do it with - and we think you will too!

description: Job Title: HR Regional PartnerAt TE, you will unleash your potential working with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to create a safer, sustainable and more connected world. They implement Human Resources policies at the country, regional or global level partnering with management to drive company-wide programs and initiatives.  We are seeking a talented, innovative, customer focused HR Leader for our Fuquay Varina, NC location, supporting our Energy Business Unit. The ideal candidate will have a passion for providing first class HR support to our talented and highly engaged employees. As part of North America HR Solutions team, you will be joining a group of professionals who are passionate about ensuring the future growth of the business while maintaining integrity, taking accountability, working together and continually improving to ensure constant innovation and openness to change. You are the trusted advisor for your management team. Reporting to the HR Regional Manager, this position will closely partner with HR Business leaders to guarantee alignment in approaching business needs. The role requires one to effectively work with other HR functions to direct and ensure the successful delivery of HR services required to drive business imperatives within an assigned geographical region and proactively seeks to identify and resolve issues driving HR operational excellence through TEOA (TE’s Continuous Improvement Program).  Short DescriptionProactively drive effective HR solutions for client groups comprised Engineers, Product Managers and Manufacturing professionals. Support building leader capability, improving workforce capability and positive employee relations practices. Provide coaching and consulting to the managers and employees in the areas of performance management, compensation, employee retention, talent planning, leader and employee development, positive employee relations practices, and conflict resolution. Understand business cycles and talent needs of the organization to develop human capital strategies to build the capability of the workforce to meet business goals. Support recruiting and staffing initiatives, counsel managers in final selections and compensation; Consult with leaders for talent planning and career development. Facilitate HR and Organizational Development training resources to local Managers to assist them in developing their people management skills. Work with the HR Innovation Centers on compensation and benefits management, payroll and salary administration. What your background should look like:Bachelor’s degree or above or equivalent experience; HR related major preferred 3+ years’ experience within Human Resource; Ideal candidate will have previous experience within a Generalist capacity, offering a broad range of expertise within HR spanning Employee Relations, Talent Acquisition, Coaching and Development. Experience partnering with business leaders in a matrixed environment requiring influencing skills. Must have an effective balance between strategic and tactical implementation skills. Ability to provide innovative solutions and adapt in a rapidly changing environment. Ability to act as a credible coach and facilitator and a credible role model for effective leadership and performance. Build trust and credibility among his/her team and at all levels within the organization. Must have a high level of interpersonal skills, strong organizational and analytical skills; Process orientated and sense of urgency. Travel within region as business needs dictate (up to 10%)Human Resource experience within a manufacturing environment is preferredCompetenciesValues: Integrity, Accountability, Inclusion, Innovation, TeamworkABOUT TE CONNECTIVITYTE Connectivity is a global industrial technology leader creating a safer, sustainable, productive, and connected future. Our broad range of connectivity and sensor solutions enable the distribution of power, signal and data to advance next-generation transportation, renewable energy, automated factories, data centers, medical technology and more. With more than 85,000 employees, including 8,000 engineers, working alongside customers in approximately 140 countries. TE ensures that EVERY CONNECTION COUNTS. Learn more at www.te.com and on LinkedIn, Facebook, WeChat, Instagram and X (formerly Twitter).COMPENSATION• Competitive base salary commensurate with experience: $86,240 – $129,360 (subject to change dependent on physical location)• Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. TE Connectivity reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the experience/qualification of the selected candidate as well as internal and external equity.• Total Compensation = Base Salary + Incentive(s) + BenefitsBENEFITS• A comprehensive benefits package including health insurance, 401(k), disability, life insurance, employee stock purchase plan, paid time off and voluntary benefits.EOE, Including Disability/Vets

title: VP, Trading & Market Operations
description:
ROLE: VP, Trading & Market Operations

LOCATION: Houston(Preference) / New York

Company Overview

Our client, a leading independent power producer, is at the forefront of the renewable energy transition, spearheading the development of sustainable energy projects while prioritizing community partnerships and environmental stewardship. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, with a nationwide presence, our client boasts a robust portfolio of renewable energy projects and a commitment to driving positive change in the clean energy sector.

Job Summary

The VP, Trading & Market Operations plays a pivotal role in our client's mission by overseeing trading operations and strategic planning within their rapidly expanding renewable energy portfolio. This key leadership position entails shaping and executing trading strategies, managing risk, and fostering alignment between trading initiatives and broader organizational objectives. As the primary liaison with the parent company, the VP ensures coherence between trading strategies and risk management frameworks.

Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership: Contribute to strategic planning initiatives, identify growth opportunities, and provide insights for greenfield development projects.Risk Communication: Liaise with the Chief Risk Officer at Brookfield to ensure alignment between trading strategies and risk management principlesCurve Maintenance and Valuation: Maintain accurate forward curves for commodities and assist in the valuation of Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) to enhance financial analysis.Trading and Portfolio Management: Develop and execute trading strategies across various products, leveraging market analysis and risk management tools.Operational Engagement: Provide hands-on leadership in daily trading decisions and collaborate closely with asset operations teams.Team Development: Outline and execute plans for the expansion of the trading function, including budgeting, staffing, and skill development.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Coordinate with regulatory, risk, asset management, and finance departments to integrate trading strategiesMarket Analysis and Optimization: Oversee the optimization of renewable asset portfolios and ensure strategic asset management within the market.

Requirements

Advanced degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or related field preferred.Minimum of 10 years of experience in energy markets, with a focus on renewable energy trading and portfolio management.Proven leadership skills and experience managing both strategic and operational aspects of trading functions.Strong analytical skills, proficiency in financial modeling, and trading software.Deep knowledge of PJM and MISO markets, regulatory environments, and the renewable energy landscape.Exceptional negotiation and communication skills, capable of engaging with senior management, external partners, and regulatory agencies.

description:

These values translate into creating the coolest brand on the plant, where talented people want to grow their careers…and here is how!

title: Manufacturing Process Engineer II
description:
Location: Pawtucket, RI

Resuscitation

At ZOLL, we're passionate about improving patient outcomes and helping save lives.

We provide innovative technologies that make a meaningful difference in people's lives. Our medical devices, software and related services are used worldwide to diagnose and treat patients suffering from serious cardiopulmonary and respiratory conditions.

The Acute Care Technology division of ZOLL develops and delivers innovative lifesaving products and software solutions to EMS, hospital, public safety, and military customers globally. Our dedicated employees take pride in their commitment to improving patient outcomes while delivering world-class customer service.

At ZOLL, you won’t just have a job. You’ll have a career—and a purpose.

Join our team. It’s a great time to be a part of ZOLL!

Job Summary

Responsible for partnering with the manufacturing, engineering and quality teams in the design, implementation and validation of new processes to manufacture high quality medical devices and associated accessories. Utilizes a variety of tools to continuously improve existing manufacturing while acting as an innovator in the areas of Lean manufacturing processes. Works with in-house personnel to develop test recommendations to ensure that product requirements meet customer expectations and are testable. Works to standardize manufacturing processes and put appropriate controls in place to monitor status. Interacts with product development engineers and is responsible for leading product transfer involving process capability and operator training.

Essential Functions

Optimize manufacturing processes to provide sustainable gains in gross margin and product performance through capital projects, statistical analysis, designed experiments, procedural changes, simulation and modelingProvide on-going technical support to production line for equipment, process, or design related issuesMonitor process and equipment performance; identify and implement process improvement activities to increase/optimize yield, efficiency or throughputMaintain safety, product quality, and manufacturing effectiveness by examining equipment, processes, operations, product components and assembly to determine time or quality revisions and suggests/implements improvementsWorks with suppliers and participates in multi-functional teams to resolve technical/quality issues and develop new productsParticipate in new product design and development reviews; suggest ways to enhance DFM; develop process FMEAs; lead transfer of products from design to production; supports product scale-up activitiesDrive a Lean culture of continuous improvement; lead and participate in Kaizen events; promote 5s activity to standardize work; work with manufacturing manager to establish task time to maximize throughput, reduce cycle time, identify constraints and balance work content; create and update value stream mapsSpecify, evaluate, select, and implement new equipment and fixtures; develop and execute installation, operation, and performance qualification protocolsDesign and implement validation protocols for process improvements and material changes including comprehensive engineering reports providing analysis of resultsDevelop efficient, effective systems for capturing critical process metrics for all manufacturing operations; implement automated data collection where possible


Required/Preferred Education And Experience

BS in industrial engineering required orOther technical degree with equivalent experience requiredMinimum of 2-4-years’ experience in a commercial manufacturing environment driving continuous improvement with demonstrated experience in use of rotary/converting equipment and automation of manufacturing processes. required andMedical device manufacturing experience with exposure to FDA requirements required andProduction of electromechanical assemblies required


Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

Experienced in designing and performing process validationsWorks well in dynamic, cross-functional team environmentStrong analytical skills and common sense with emphasis on a scientific method of problem solvingAble to model and simulate manufacturing flowsAble to accept and produce timely results on multiple concurrent projects of significant complexityAble to write clear, concise and visual work instructionsPossess effective verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills to interact with associates at all levels of the organizationKnowledge of design controls, FDA and MDD requirements; able to work within a medical device quality management systemStrong project management skills sufficient to take a proposed solution from resource appropriation through project scheduling and execution as well as being able to work as part of a decision-making team to bring about positive changeHas a fundamental drive for continuous process improvement.


ZOLL is a fast-growing company that operates in more than 140 countries around the world. Our employees are inspired by a commitment to make a difference in patients' lives, and our culture values innovation, self-motivation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Join us in our efforts to improve outcomes for underserved patients suffering from critical cardiopulmonary conditions and help save more lives.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description:
